results.definition: to break and turn over earth especially with a plow
examples: turn the earth in the Spring

results.definition: twist suddenly so as to sprain
examples: I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days

results.definition: pass into a condition gradually, take on a specific property or attribute; become
examples: The weather turned nasty

results.definition: cause to move around a center so as to show another side of
examples: turn a page of a book

results.definition: undergo a change or development
examples: The water turned into ice
He turned traitor

results.definition: let (something) fall or spill from a container
examples: turn the flour onto a plate

results.definition: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
examples: the strong man could turn an iron bar

results.definition: undergo a transformation or a change of position or action
examples: We turned from Socialism to Capitalism
The people turned against the President when he stole the election

results.definition: pass to the other side of
examples: turn the corner

results.definition: have recourse to or make an appeal or request for help or information to
examples: She turned to her relatives for help

results.definition: turning or twisting around (in place)
a favor for someone
examples: he did me a good turn

results.definition: change to the contrary
examples: the tides turned against him
public opinion turned when it was revealed that the president had an affair with a White House intern

results.definition: (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession
examples: it is my turn

results.definition: a short performance that is part of a longer program
a circular segment of a curve
(sports) a division during which one team is on the offensive
a time period for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
a movement in a new direction
examples: the turning of the wind

results.definition: an unforeseen development
examples: events suddenly took an awkward turn

results.definition: the act of changing or reversing the direction of the course
examples: he took a turn to the right

results.definition: go sour or spoil
examples: The cream has turned--we have to throw it out

results.definition: accomplish by rotating
examples: turn a somersault
turn cartwheels

results.definition: alter the functioning or setting of
examples: turn the dial to 10
turn the heat down

results.definition: become officially one year older
examples: She is turning 50 this year

results.definition: cause to change or turn into something different;assume new characteristics
examples: The princess turned the frog into a prince by kissing him
The alchemists tried to turn lead into gold

results.definition: cause to move along an axis or into a new direction
examples: turn your face to the wall
turn the car around
turn your dance partner around

results.definition: cause to move around or rotate
examples: turn a key
turn your palm this way

results.definition: change color
examples: In Vermont, the leaves turn early

results.definition: change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
examples: The mugger turned and fled before I could see his face
She turned from herself and learned to listen to others' needs

results.definition: channel one's attention, interest, thought, or attention toward or away from something
examples: The pedophile turned to boys for satisfaction
people turn to mysticism at the turn of a millennium

results.definition: direct at someone
examples: She turned a smile on me
They turned their flashlights on the car

results.definition: get by buying and selling
examples: the company turned a good profit after a year

results.definition: move around an axis or a center
examples: The wheels are turning

results.definition: shape by rotating on a lathe or cutting device or a wheel
examples: turn the legs of the table
turn the clay on the wheel

results.definition: taking a short walk out and back
examples: we took a turn in the park

results.definition: the act of turning away or in the opposite direction
examples: he made an abrupt turn away from her

results.definition: to send or let go
examples: They turned away the crowd at the gate of the governor's mansion
